title: I Am Not Your Negro
creator_credit: James Baldwin, Velvet Film, Raoul Peck, RTS, Shelter Prod, ARTE, RTBF and Independent Lens
headline_credit: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
brief_description: Working from the text of James Baldwin’s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.

constellations_other.name: MLK/FBI: blackness In America
constellations_other.description: Award-winning documentarian Sam Pollard looks at J. Edgar Hoover and the FBI’s pursuit of Martin Luther King Jr in the lead-up to his assassination during America’s Civil Rights Movement of the sixties.

constellations_other.name: My Hometown: Archives woven into new narrative
constellations_other.description: Offering viewers a snapshot of life on the road for an Australian touring band in the 1960s, 'My Hometown', directed by Sari Braithwaite was developed reimagining archival 8mm footage shot by drummer Leon Isackson.

creator_credit_for_label: James Baldwin, Velvet Film, Raoul Peck, RTS, Shelter Prod, ARTE, RTBF and Independent Lens
headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France and United States of America, 2017
description: Working from the text of James Baldwin’s unfinished final novel, director Raoul Peck creates a meditation on what it means to be Black in the United States.
